intro: Gnaphalium depilatum, commonly known as the woolly everlasting, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage and small, daisy-like flowers. The plant is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. It produces yellow disc flowers surrounded by pale green to white ray florets. Gnaphalium depilatum is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
